content.description: Fun stem to start, that doesn't last long before slabbing it to the chain anchor.
content.location: Look for the notch above a tree, around the trailside corner from Warpdrive

content.description: Start in the water groove and stem/wiggle your way up clipping bolts as you go.  Finish is steeper than it looks.
content.location: Right of the two routes on the bottom of Bird Rock.

content.description: Entry level moves on good moss covered rock.
content.location: Lowest route on the approach trail side of Bird Rock.

content.description: Finger heavy, small holds, fight the barn door to the finish.
content.location: Lowest route on the west side of Bird Rock.

content.description: Steep for the grade, underclings and jugs take you to the technical balance moves at the finish.
content.location: Second route downhill of the highballs on the west side of the rock.  Look for steep rock covered with jugular flakes.

content.description: Start using good holds for a few powerful moves. From here move above a small left-leaning block into a crack on the left side of the arete. Stepping onto the right-hand shelf demotes the grade.  Stay true to the arete/right face to the anchors.
content.location: Westmost route on the top side of bird rock.

content.description: Steep bouldery start on good holds yields a technical slab to the anchors. Very well bolted.
content.location: Steeper and left most of the two routes on the lowest corner of Bird Rock.

content.description: Another 5.7 route on Bird Rock.  However this ones historical.  FA by Bill Newcomb on a misty, rainy day.  Equipped with bolting gear and  rope to drill an anchor and start bolting routes.
content.location: Highest route on approach trail side of the rock before the 5.11 High Ball.

content.description: Overhung start in a good rail leads to a huge pocket.  Move from the pocket to another god rail before embarking on a bumpy and steep jug haul for a body length or more.  Finish by pulling into the balancy stance and finding the funk to clip.
content.location: Fourth route from the top of the rock on the west face.

content.description: A steep and pumpy route on a juggy right-leaning arete. Watch out for the Z clip from the last bolt to the anchors.
content.location: On the highest side of bird rock, facing the approach trail.

content.description: Short power crux followed by a thinner less secure move.  Cheating left at the start lowers the grade.
content.location: First route downhill of the Jet's Highball.

content.description: Approach the crag from the road, the first formation on the right as you drop down into the crag. Bird rock hosts 10+ routes ranging from 5.7 to 5.12.
